newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - finishes up 1/4 to 3/8.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - finishes up 1/4 to 3/8.

text.p: U.S. municipal bond prices ended Wednesday's session up about 1/4 to 3/8 point, as traders said new issues received good demand.

"There was institutional selling in here, but most of these deals did pretty well," one trader said. "I saw a lot of retail in there, too, so maybe 'retail/retail' has finally acclimated to the new levels here," he added, referring to increased to demand from individual retail investors, as opposed to retail investors represented by mutual funds.
Traders also noted that the Blue List of secondary market offerings had dropped to $1 billion from about $1.5 billion over the past several sessions, another indication of a pick-up in demand.
Market participants said the stronger government market also led munis higher on Wednesday, as the long bond rose 10/32 at 100-27/32 to yield 6.56 percent.

Government securities held onto midday gains after the Treasury auctioned $8 billion of inflation-indexed 5-year notes at an average yield of 3.744 percent. Analysts predicted a yield in the range of 3.72 percent to 3.74 percent.
In late day muni repricings, Lehman Brothers said it lowered yields in several maturities on California Housing Finance Agency's $134 million bond deal.
Earlier in the day, Bear, Stearns & Co. said it repriced Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority's $120 million bond deal, lowering maturities five basis points in all maturities.
In competitive action, Bear Stearns said it had a $58.6 million balance on the day's largest new issue, a $265 million Washington general obligation offering.
In the muni secondary, bids on Allegheny County Sanitary Authority, Pa., MBIA 5-3/8s of 2024 fell three basis points from Tuesday's close to 5.50 percent.
Florida Ports Financing Commission MBIA 5-3/8s of 2027 were two basis points lower, at 5.56 percent.

Muni futures also showed improvement. September futures closed 10/32 higher to 119-11/32, while September T-bonds were 9/32 higher at 113-29/32. The MOB spread widened to 174 ticks from 173 at the close Tuesday.
Municipal bond sales for Thursday were expected to total $362 million in 17 sales, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Negotiated offerings total $197 million in seven sales, with a $100 million Port Authority of New York & New Jersey deal through Lehman Brothers topping the list.
On the competitive side, 10 sales totaling $165 million are scheduled. A $40 million Kansas City deal at 1000 EDT is the largest.
Thursday's economic indicators include initial claims for the week ended July 5. Economists surveyed by Reuters expect the figure, which is set for release at 0830 EDT, to be 341,000.
On Friday, the market gets the Producer Price Index for June. Economists predicted the figure would be unchanged overall and up 0.1 percent excluding food and energy.
